CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12, reads: "Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the 'Hot Mikado' Bill 'Bojangles' Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and the comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of the city, a veritable goodwill ambassador."
TitMainTitle: Bill "Bojangles" Robinson standing next to woman, possibly Fannie Clay Robinson, and William "Woogie" Harris, in Crawford Grill No. 1
